image.altText: The Australian Aboriginal flag at the top of South Australia's parliament.

props.synopsis: It's been two years since South Australia's Parliament passed historic legislation establishing a First Nations Voice. How is it working?

title.children: SA Voice members says it's like 'flying the plane and building it at the same time'

image.altText: A woman in a blue jacket speaking in a corridor with a light above her head

props.synopsis: The Greens say they will push to increase the environment’s share of funding in the federal budget to one per cent if they hold the balance of power after the election.

title.children: Greens reveal environment spending plan for minority government

image.altText: Black and yellow packets of cigarettes in a white drawer full of packs.

props.synopsis: A decline in cigarette sales amid a boom in illegal tobacco has added to the stress for small businesses already struggling.

title.children: Cigarette retailers struggle as smokers turn to black market

image.altText: Dead fish by a boot, for size reference. The boot is a quarter of the fish's length.

props.synopsis: Residents say they have seen fish and other marine life washed ashore in the days since a large-scale toxic algae bloom and fish kill at Fleurieu Peninsula beaches.

title.children: Kangaroo Islanders report 'hundreds' of dead fish on beaches

image.altText: Anthony Albanese smiles at a medical staff at a press conference inside a hospital

props.synopsis: Both federal Labor and the Coalition have pledged to contribute $150 million towards a new $300 million healthcare centre planned at Flinders University.

title.children: Bipartisan support to invest $150m for health training hub in SA

image.altText: Flames and smoke coming from a low scrubby area

props.synopsis: The South Australian Country Fire Service (CFS) says the threat from a bushfire burning near Robe, in the state's south-east, has reduced.

title.children: Reduced threat from bushfire burning near Robe in south-east SA

image.altText: an image of a car's driver side mirror with a truck reflected, driving through a town

props.synopsis: A freight bypass estimated to divert up to 420,000 trucks a year from congested Adelaide thoroughfares is back on the agenda following the federal budget.

title.children: Long-awaited SA freight route back on table ahead of federal election

image.altText: GettyImages-2207446962

props.synopsis: The sea shanty Bound for South Australia has become an anthem that celebrates the distinctiveness of a state not necessarily renowned for distinction, especially on the sporting field. But the song captures the sentiment of the state's remarkable Sheffield Shield win, writes Daniel Keane.

title.children: The Sheffield Shield was Bound for South Australia, now it has arrived

image.altText: A graphic image shows Khawaja Moeen Haroon, dressed in a dark suit and tie.

props.synopsis: On the western outskirts of Melbourne, where the paddocks meet new homes, lies the centre of an alleged NDIS fraudster's network.

title.children: The man suspected of a multi-million-dollar NDIS fraud

image.altText: Nicola Spurrier is dressed in a multi-coloured jacket as she addresses the media

props.synopsis: More than 2,300 cases of the flu have been recorded in SA so far this year — 690 more than the same time last year — and the government is urging parents with young children to get their free vaccination.

title.children: Parents urged to get children vaccinated as flu cases rise in SA

image.altText: Aerial view of Tarrkarri -  a vast beige mushroom with landscaped gardens in the centre of the CBD

props.synopsis: SA Premier Peter Malinauskas has announced more funding for the arts, but none to help build a long-delayed First Nations cultural centre in Adelaide's CBD.

title.children: Dream for SA First Nations cultural centre 'still alive', Premier says

image.altText: Donald Trump stands and speaks at a podium in front of a portrait of Ronald Reagan

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's preoccupation with tariffs isn't new. But economists say US history shows trade barriers end up costing consumers and businesses more.

title.children: History of American tariffs offers stark insights into Trump's plans

image.altText: Steph Hodgins-May speaks in the senate

props.synopsis: At some point, the major political parties will have to confront the failures in Australia’s early childhood education and care system head on.

title.children: The perfect election issue is being overlooked by most politicians

image.altText: A close-up of Luigi Mangione.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's attorney-general orders prosecutors to seek the death penalty for Luigi Mangione, the man accused of murdering a health insurance boss on a New York street last year.

title.children: Trump administration to pursue death sentence for Luigi Mangione

image.altText: Russian President Vladimir Putin sitting at a desk with a Russian flag behind him.

props.synopsis: The Russian military has been seeking to boost its military to some 1.5 million active soldiers, as the country continues its conflict in Ukraine.

title.children: Putin launches fresh conscription drive to find 160,000 more troops

image.altText: Min Aung Hlaing wears a military dress uniform with medals on his chest and around his neck.

props.synopsis: Multiple Western aid agencies said they have struggled to get personnel into Myanmar as the ruling junta leads the response to the country's largest natural disaster in years.

title.children: In Myanmar's darkest hour, this dictator cloaks the country in secrecy

props.synopsis: A project in regional NSW has shown the number of students at risk of homelessness can be halved with a "deceptively simple" intervention.

title.children: Can we end youth homelessness before it begins? One city shows it can be done

image.altText: A worried-looking woman and man standing in a park.

props.synopsis: As NSW prepares to ban no-grounds evictions, some renters believe they're being forced out as landlords try to get ahead of the change.

title.children: Tenants fear surge of evictions ahead of major rental law reforms

image.altText: People and dog aerial pic

props.synopsis: Graziers have recounted the moment they found a man who had been missing for a few days after becoming stuck in western Queensland floodwater.

title.children: 'Sheer volume' of floodwater astounds as rescuers share incredible survival story

image.altText: albanese dutton

props.synopsis: The two leaders find common ground on tariffs, the mortgage wars ramp up and a teal apologises for a blunder.

title.children: Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton agree on Trump tariff position

image.altText: A map showing where pedestrians could face pinch points.

props.synopsis: With the row over whether Tasmania can afford a new stadium a long way from ending, Labor may think it can be a spectator to the melee. But, if Labor votes for the project and it goes badly, it'll be tied to the failure as well.

title.children: If Labor hitches its wagon to a stadium project flop, it'll be tied to the failure as well

image.altText: Panoramic view of lava

props.synopsis: A volcanic eruption in Iceland has triggered an evacuation near the nation's capital.

title.children: Iceland town and Blue Lagoon spa evacuated after volcano erupts

image.altText: a woman with a bulging prosthetic left eye.

props.synopsis: Losing an eye is a traumatic experience, having an artificial eye made should help with the healing process. For these people, who were clients of Jack McDonald, it wasn't.

title.children: 'Unsightly, uncomfortable and unacceptable': Concerns over prosthetic eye maker

image.altText: A home buyer looks at documents. In the foreground of the image is a model house and keys.

props.synopsis: The Coalition is promising to relax home lending rules if elected, to allow prospective buyers to borrow more. But will this actually make it easier for first home buyers to break into the market?

title.children: The Coalition's latest pitch for first home buyers benefits existing owners more

image.altText: People walking past the outside of the Reserve Bank of Australia in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The RBA board has kept its cash rate target unchanged at 4.1 per cent this month, after delivering its first cut since November 2020 at its Feburary meeting.

title.children: Reserve Bank leaves interest rates on hold at April meeting

image.altText: People point to a destroyed building.

props.synopsis: Human rights groups fear the military is using logistical challenges as an excuse to withhold aid from rebel-held areas.

title.children: Myanmar's earthquake survivors accuse the military of holding up aid

image.altText: Animated Snow White from 1937 film, sits on the forest floor surrounded by cute animals

props.synopsis: Almost 90 years after their first imagining of Snow White, Disney decided to take another bite of the apple. But what does each era's "fairest of them all" reflect about attitudes towards women?

title.children: How Snow White holds a (magic) mirror up to society

image.altText: a group of politicians on a podium in front of a blue backdrop

props.synopsis: The opposition leader has slammed the prime minister's response to a Chinese research ship south of Australia, saying he believes the vessel is gathering intelligence and mapping the route of Australia's undersea cables.

title.children: Dutton says Chinese research ship mapping undersea cables along Australia's coastline

image.altText: A court sketch of a man in a suit in a witness dock

props.synopsis: Andre Rebelo, who murdered his mother Colleen so he could claim more than $1 million in life insurance policies he'd taken out in her name, is jailed by a WA Supreme Court judge.

title.children: Man who killed mother for money to maintain glam influencer lifestyle jailed

image.altText: Melissa Caddick missing

props.synopsis: Sydney fraudster Melissa Caddick left investors almost $24 million out of pocket through their self-managed superannuation funds before she disappeared in November 2020.

title.children: Victims of Sydney con-woman Melissa Caddick receive $3.5m settlement

image.altText: A cigarette with the words "causes 16 cancers" on the filter

props.synopsis: We have a "relatively low" smoking rate, but the Cancer Council says 66 Australians are still dying from smoking-related illness every day.

title.children: Menthol cigarettes banned and every stick to hold a warning

image.altText: Elephants in the water.

props.synopsis: Botswana's elephant population has doubled in recent decades, creating chaos for many who live alongside them.

title.children: 'Elephants are terrorists': The unintended consequences of an African triumph

image.altText: Ursula von der Leyen wearing a light pink jacket and black top speaking at a blue lectern with two microphones

props.synopsis: Europe is open to negotiate looming trade tariffs with the US Trump administration but is willing to retaliate with countermeasures if required, European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen says.

title.children: Europe joins growing list of nations preparing to oppose Trump tariffs

image.altText: A digital rendering of a metal pipe in a tunnel

props.synopsis: Europe’s largest physics lab is planning to build the tunnel beneath France and Switzerland — allowing it to smash tiny particles together with eight times more energy than before.

title.children: Inside the plan to build a 91km, particle-smashing tunnel under Europe
